episodes.title: "I Didn’t Know She Was Here": Wexner Cornered Over Maria Farmer Allegations | APT
episodes.description:
During a deposition, Les Wexner was questioned about Epstein survivor Maria Farmer, who is not present in court. Farmer alleges she was assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein near Wexner’s property in 1996. Wexner repeatedly claimed ignorance, saying, “I didn’t know shit about her” and insisting he had no knowledge of her being on or near his property. Court records reveal the stark contrast between the survivor’s allegations and Wexner’s blunt denials, raising new questions about his ties to Epstein and the management of his estate.

episodes.description:
During a deposition, Les Wexner was confronted point-blank about a birthday letter he sent to Jeffrey Epstein. In the note, Wexner drew a crude sketch and signed “Your friend Leslie,” despite repeatedly claiming Epstein was not a friend. Wexner admitted he was “trying to be funny,” raising questions about the nature of his relationship with Epstein and his judgment at the time. episodes.title: ‘Friendly, Not Friends’: Les Wexner Denies Close Ties to Epstein | APT
episodes.description:
U.S. billionaire Leslie Wexner has denied ever being friends with Jeffrey Epstein, describing him instead as “the world’s all-time con artist.” In a tense deposition to the House Oversight Committee, Wexner insisted he was friendly with Epstein in a professional sense but had no personal bond. He explained how Epstein conned him despite their long association, highlighting the financier’s connections to royalty, politicians, and other high-profile figures. Wexner’s testimony sheds light on the controversial relationship between one of America’s richest men and Epstein, while also addressing widespread misconceptions about their closeness.

episodes.title: Newly Released Emails Tie Epstein to 'Devil’s Breath' Drug | APT
episodes.description:
Newly released Epstein Files have revealed disturbing new emails suggesting Jeffrey Epstein inquired about “trumpet plants at nursery” — a reference experts say may point to Angel’s Trumpet, a highly toxic plant known to produce scopolamine.

Often called “Devil’s Breath” or the “zombie drug,” scopolamine has been linked to memory loss, impaired decision-making, extreme suggestibility, and in severe cases, paralysis or death. Reports from TMZ, AOL, and others detail emails showing Epstein not only asking about the plants but also receiving articles explaining the drug’s effects.

The latest document dump adds another controversial layer to the ongoing scrutiny of Epstein’s activities. A victim statement included in the files allegedly describes symptoms consistent with scopolamine exposure.

In this video, we break down:
• What Angel’s Trumpet is
• What scopolamine does to the body
• What the newly released emails say
• Why this is raising new questions

Jeffrey Epstein died in 2019 while awaiting trial on federal sex-trafficking charges, but court-ordered document releases continue to generate headlines.

This video discusses allegations and reported document findings. No new criminal charges have been announced in connection to these claims.

#EpsteinFiles #JeffreyEpstein #Scopolamine #AngelTrumpet #BreakingNews #EpsteinUpdate #DevilsBreath #TrueCrime #InvestigativeNews #DocumentDump #GhislaineMaxwell #PoliticalNews

Former U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton says questions about her and her husband’s alleged connections to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein are a “diversion away from Trump.”

In an interview with German TV program Maischberger, Clinton stated: “We have nothing to hide.”

Clinton also suggested that those raising the issue may be trying to shield President Donald Trump.

While former President Bill Clinton appears in Epstein-related documents, no evidence has emerged implicating either Clinton in criminal wrongdoing.

The interview is scheduled to air on February 18.

episodes.title: LIVE | “We’re Not Going Anywhere”: Epstein Survivors Return to Capitol as AG Pam Bondi’s Hearing Beg
episodes.description:
Epstein survivors are back at the US Capitol alongside members of the Democratic Women’s Caucus ahead of Attorney General Pam Bondi’s testimony before the House Judiciary Committee.
Lawmakers and survivors delivered emotional remarks, calling for accountability and criticizing the Justice Department’s handling of the Epstein files. Speakers said survivors continue to face trauma while demanding transparency and answers from the administration.
Several members of Congress pledged to press Bondi directly during the hearing, vowing to seek clarity on investigative decisions and the release of sensitive information.
Watch live coverage and key moments from Capitol Hill.

episodes.title: “She Will Never Tell the Truth”: Epstein Survivor Attorney Criticizes Maxwell’s Deposition | APT
episodes.description:

McCawley criticizes Maxwell for lying repeatedly in past interviews and says she has “critical information” that could clarify the involvement of powerful individuals, including former presidents. The deposition raises questions about clemency requests and ongoing investigations, as additional depositions are scheduled for Hillary and Bill Clinton.

episodes.title: Jeffrey Epstein Asked Point Blank: “How Long Have You Been Attracted to Underage Girls?” | APT
episodes.description:
Newly released U.S. Department of Justice files have brought renewed attention to Jeffrey Epstein, featuring a nearly 90-minute video deposition recorded in February 2010. In the footage, Epstein is asked directly under oath about his alleged sexual attraction to underage girls during questioning linked to a 2008 civil lawsuit.

The deposition includes sharp exchanges between Epstein, the plaintiff’s attorney Brad Edwards, and Epstein’s legal counsel, who raises repeated objections throughout the session. The video is part of a broader document release connected to federal investigations into Epstein’s abuse allegations.
The revelations have sparked fresh debate over accountability, elite protection, and the handling of high-profile sex abuse cases in the United States.


#JeffreyEpstein #EpsteinFiles #EpsteinDeposition #DOJ #USNews #BreakingNews #InternationalNews #APTNews #JusticeSystem #CourtFootage

Newly released documents from the Jeffrey Epstein case have revealed previously unseen emails between Melania Trump — then Melania Knauss — and Epstein’s close associate Ghislaine Maxwell.

In one October 2002 email, Melania writes to Maxwell with a friendly tone, mentioning Palm Beach, travel plans, and complimenting Maxwell. While the correspondence shows a personal connection, there are no allegations of wrongdoing against Melania or Donald Trump.

These emails are part of the final batch of over 3 million pages made public by the Department of Justice, which also feature high-profile figures like Bill Gates, Elon Musk, Prince Andrew, and more.

🔹 What does this reveal about Epstein’s social circle?

episodes.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Asked Point-Blank If She Recruited Masseuses From Donald Trump’s Mar-a-Lago | APT
episodes.description:
In a revealing moment from newly surfaced interview transcripts, Ghislaine Maxwell is asked point-blank whether she ever recruited masseuses from Donald Trump’s Mar-a-Lago resort to give private massages to Jeffrey Epstein.

Maxwell insists she “absolutely never” recruited spa workers from Mar-a-Lago and says she never witnessed Trump in any inappropriate situation. She also describes seeing Trump and Epstein only in social settings and denies any knowledge of misconduct involving Trump.

The exchange adds another layer to the ongoing scrutiny surrounding Epstein’s network, the so-called “black book,” and the powerful figures connected to the case.

Watch as investigators press Maxwell directly on one of the most controversial questions tied to Epstein’s world.

#epstein #trump #apt

episodes.title: “Oversight on Epstein Ends With a Showerhead Bill” — Rep. Melanie Stansbury | APT
episodes.description:
House Oversight Committee member Rep. Melanie Stansbury blasted Republican leadership after a full day of hearings that included new subpoenas in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation and a classified briefing on Venezuela, only to end with a bill focused on showerhead regulations. Stansbury criticized the priorities of House Republicans, saying, “After a full day in Oversight…House Republicans have brought us… a bill about showerheads. That’s right — showerheads.” Her remarks underscore Democratic frustration with legislative focus amid ongoing investigations and policy debates.
